intro: Thelypodium brachycarpum var. crispum, commonly known as the curly thelypodium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. The plant thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
